title: Melbourne Victory v Western Sydney Wanderers
articleDescription: A-League Round 9 match at AAMI Park on Saturday 10 January 2026
articleContent:
Experience the thrill of the A-League Men 2025-26 season as Melbourne Victory take on Western Sydney Wanderers at AAMI Park. 

The game will begin at 5:00pm

Before you travel

If you use Journey Planner within 14 days of this event, you'll see all the extra services we've added to help you get there.

Metropolitan train

Additional services for the following lines depart after the match:

  • Ringwood, Glen Waverly, Dandenong

Frankston passengers are advised to alight on Dandenong Group services from Richmond (Platform 6, then transfer at Caulfield for a connecting train. 

Sandringham passengers are advised to alight on any available service from Jolimont (Platform 1) or Richmond (Platforms 7 & 8) then transfer at Flinders Street for a train to Parliament to enable a bus connection.

Werribee passengers are advised to alight on any available service from Jolimont (Platform 1) or Richmond (Platforms 7 & 8) then transfer at Flinders Street for a train to Southern Cross.
 

Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Route 70

  • Trams will operate from Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

Metropolitan bus

Customers can catch the following buses close to the MCG:

  • Route 246

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the match.

Regional train

  • Normal services departing from Southern Cross Station

Additional information

  • Download our free mobile apps for Android and iOS to get public transport information on the go. You can also top up your myki instantly in the app.
  • If you need accessibility information and assistance, see Accessibility.
  • Top up your myki before travelling or set Auto Top Up so you never need to top up again. For more information, see Auto Top Up.
  • Mobile myki is a new way to travel with myki. It’s a digital myki on your Android phone on the Google Wallet™ app.
  • For information about tickets for children and concessions, see Children and Concessions.
  • If you need more information or special assistance, please call 1800 800 007 before travelling.
